title: Online Elementary Social Project Design Competency Enhancement Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental Understanding of Primary Education Curriculum and Project-Based Learning Experience
context.additional_context: Utilization of customized online design tools considering learner characteristics (lack of field experience) and BYOD environments.

learning_goals: Develop at least three activities reflecting learner characteristics when designing online learning environments

Learners can create one digital rubric for project-based social studies assessments within a week, meeting the following criteria: 1) include at least five evaluation items, 2) specify a four-level scale (excellent–good–fair–poor) for each item, and 3) upload and share it on Google Sheets or Notion platforms.

Learners can use higher education design tools (e.g., Articulate 360, Canva) to produce a design document for a one-week short-term course, including learning objectives, assessment methods, and activity designs, and submit a final output meeting at least six of eight provided checklist items.
Propose at least two formative assessment strategies to enhance student engagement
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
